member.name: IFileSystemImage2.get_BootImageOptionsArray
member.summary: Retrieves the boot option array that will be utilized to generate the file system image.
member.param: Pointer to a boot option array that contains a list of interfaces of boot images used to generate the file system image. Each element of the list is a VARIANT of type VT_DISPATCH.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

listheader.description:
A boot object can only be included in an initial disc image.
Value: 0xC0AAB149

The boot object could not be added to the image.
Value: 0xC0AAB148

member.name: IFileSystemImage2.put_BootImageOptionsArray
member.summary: Sets the boot option array that will be utilized to generate the file system image. Unlike , this method will not create a complete copy of each boot options array element, but instead use references to each element.
member.param: List of interfaces of the boot images that will be utilized to generate the file system image. Each element of the list is a VARIANT of the type VT_DISPATCH.

returns.para: S_OK is returned on success, but other success codes may be returned as a result of implementation. The following error codes are commonly returned on operation failure, but do not represent the only possible error values:

listheader.description:
A boot object can only be included in an initial disc image.
Value: 0xC0AAB149

The boot object could not be added to the image.
Value: 0xC0AAB148

summary.para:
Use this interface to write multiple boot entries or boot images required for the EFI/UEFI support. For example, boot media with boot straps for both Windows XP and Windows Vista.
Note The IFileSystemImage2 interface is currently only available with Windows Vista with Service Pack 1 (SP1) and Windows Server 2008.
